snippet: Data suggests that a lot of customers are keeping the health plans they purchased through the federal exchange, even though their premiums may rise in 2015.
abstract: New York Times analysis suggests that millions of people are choosing to stick with health insurance plans they purchased in first year of health care law despite fact that they will pay more as premiums rise in 2015; majority of users are ignoring calls from Obama administration to shop around on digital exchanges, preferring continuity to savings; experts worry about toll trend will take on those in lower income brackets.
lead_paragraph: Data suggests that a lot of customers are keeping the health plans they purchased through the federal exchange, even though their premiums may rise in 2015.

headline.main: Many Choose Not to Save in the Health Marketplace
headline.print_headline: Many Choose Not to Save in the Health Marketplace

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
